How does blindness hinder speed??

Firstly, have you seen a blind person irl before? Even if they are very well adapted to there impairment, they still usually move more slowly than a person who has their sight, for the simple reason that it usually takes them longer to react to things. What we all see in our peripheral vision, they usually need extra time to figure out because they rely on sound, touch, and their other senses, which generally require being closer to an object before being able to detect it accurately. The fact that Lee sin even runs at all is either evidence that he isn't blind or that he has magically enhanced senses that are superior to a normal human's.

Have you ever seen Daredevil? Lee Sin is a blind monk, sure. But he sees through sound. His body has been tempered and trained to the point where blindness is more or less an advantage in battle. He's not some normal blind guy walking around with a cane
